metadata.Title: CVE-2022-36440 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A reachable assertion was found in Frrouting frr-bgpd 8.3.0 in the peek_for_as4_capability function. Attackers can maliciously construct BGP open packets and send them to BGP peers running frr-bgpd, resulting in DoS.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36440` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-pythontools - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
frr-snmp - 7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.2.1-1ubuntu0.2').
